translated: The Collection of Long Sayings .
The Questions of the Youth Piṅgiya

analyzed: jiṇṇaḥ aham asmi abalaḥ vīta vaṇṇaḥ
translated: “I am old, weak, and pale,
(so says the venerable Piṅgiya)

original: Nettā na suddhā savanaṁ na phāsu;
analyzed: nettā na suddhā savanam na phāsu
translated: My eyes are not clear, my hearing is not good;
Lest I perish, confused, in the middle,
Please explain the Dhamma so that I may understand;
The complete abandonment of birth and old age here.”
“Having seen beings afflicted by forms,
(Piṅgiya, the Blessed One said)
People are attached to forms, heedless;
Therefore, Piṅgiya, being heedful,
Abandon form for the sake of non-becoming again.”
“The four directions, the four intermediate directions,

original: Uddhaṁ adho dasa disā imāyo;🔽Na tuyhaṁ adiṭṭhaṁ asutaṁ amutaṁ,
analyzed: uddham adhas dasa disāḥ  na tuyham a diṭṭham a sutam a muta
translated: Above and below, these ten directions;🔽There is nothing in the world that you have not seen, heard, or sensed,

analyzed: atho a viññātam kiñcanam atthi loke
translated: Or that you have not known in some way;
Please explain the Dhamma so that I may understand;
The complete abandonment of birth and old age here.”
“Looking at people afflicted by craving,
(Piṅgiya, the Blessed One said)
Born from heat, overcome by old age;
Therefore, Piṅgiya, being heedful,
Abandon craving for the sake of non-becoming again.”
The Questions of the Youth Piṅgiya is the sixteenth.
